Graham Robertson); bequeathed by Robertson to the Tate Gallery (now Tate Collection) in 1948.

desc.objtitle: Christ Appearing to the Apostles after the Resurrection (Tate Collection), object 1 (Butlin 327)

objnote.p: "Christ Appearing to the Apostles after the Resurrection" illustrates Luke 24:36-40. Christ stands in the midst of his followers and shows them his stigmata, but they are "terrified and affrighted." Blake shows the apostles bowing down before Christ, with at least one clasping his hands together in prayer.

illustration.illusobjdesc: In this scene, based on Luke 24:36-40, the risen Christ appears to his worshiping disciples, who kneel on either side of him. Christ stands at the center of the composition with his arms outstretched and palms out, exposing the stigmata in his hands. He strides forward with his left foot. His head is bent to the right with eyes turned downward. Halo-like radiance surrounds his head and upper body. Three figures bow to the right of Christ. In the foreground, a gowned, bearded disciple prostrates himself with his face, lower left arm, and left palm pressed to the ground. Behind the front-most figure kneels and bows a young disciple with short, curly hair, arm bent upward, and palms probably together as if in prayer. The third figure from the front bends forward with his head down. His hair may be curly. Three figures kneel to the left of Christ. The front-most figure, a partly nude male with short, curly hair, kneels and sits upright as he looks upward towards Christ. His arms are bent upward, and his hands are together as if in prayer. The next figure from the front bows deeply. His right shoulder and right knee are visible below and to the right of the front-most figure's hands and right leg; his face is not visible but his bent arms and hands, together in prayer, are clearly represented. Only the head and gowned back of the third figure from the front are pictured. The background is not defined, but is dark, upper left and right. The narrow strip of ground below the figures might contain low-growing vegetation.

component.illusobjdesc: The risen Christ stands at the center of the composition surrounded by worshiping disciples. He strides forward with his prominent left foot. Christ's arms are extended outward from his sides at 45 degrees, with palms out and fingers spread, revealing the stigmata on his palms. His gown is draped over his right shoulder, leaving the left side of his breast uncovered. His head is bent to his left and his eyes are lowered, perhaps to look at his disciples. His hair is long and he wears a short beard. A halo-like radiant glow surrounds his head and upper body. His mouth may be slightly open; he may be speaking.

Three disciples kneel to the right of Christ. The front-most disciple, who is gowned, bearded, and has short (possibly curly) hair, bends his body sharply forward in a semi-prone or hunched-over position to prostrate himself in a deep bow at the feet of Christ. His face is pressed to the ground, as is his left palm; his left arm is bent upward at the elbow and rests on the ground. His posture suggests prayer.

Three disciples kneel to the right of Christ. The second disciple from the front is young; he kneels and bends or hunches forward in a deep bow facing down and to the left. His left arm is apparently bent upward at the elbow. His left hand is raised almost to his face; his hands may be together in prayer, although there is no clear evidence of the right hand. His left eye looks down. He is gowned and has short, curly hair.

Three disciples kneel to the right of Christ. The third gowned disciple from the front kneels and bends or hunches forward in a deep bow with his head down in a posture suggestive of prayer. Only his back, shoulders, and the top of his head, with its short and possibly curly hair, are visible.

Three disciples kneel to the left of Christ. The front-most figure is a youthful male who sits upright with his legs bent beneath him in a kneeling posture. His arms are bent upward and his palms are together with fingers spread; he is praying. With his head bent back and his right eye raised, he looks towards the risen Christ. His hair is short and curly, and a gown covers his lower body, leaving his shoulders and upper body bare. His mouth might be slightly open.

Three disciples kneel to the left of Christ. Immediately to the right of the front-most figure, the right shoulder, right knee, and arms and hands of another disciple appear. Although the backs of the second and third figures on the left are not clearly differentiated, we may also see something of his gowned back. He is very probably bent over in a deep bow, head down, like several other disciples. His arms are bent upward at the elbow and raised, apparently obscuring his face. His hands, fingers slightly spread, are together in prayer.

Three disciples kneel to the left of Christ. We see only the head (just right of the face of the front-most figure) and gowned back of the third figure from the front. Like his companions, he is probably kneeling and bent over in a deep bow to the right; he may be praying.
A halo-like radiance surrounds the head and upper body of Christ.
The background is not defined, but is dark upper left and right.
The narrow strip of ground below the figures might include low-growing vegetation such as grass, moss, or lichens.
